lead_paragraph: Officials from the group announced that they would convene a meeting on Monday to decide whether to declare a public health emergency.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

snippet: Officials from the group announced that they would convene a meeting on Monday to decide whether to declare a public health emergency.

headline.main: Zika Virus ‘Spreading Explosively’ in Americas, W.H.O. Says
headline.print_headline: W.H.O. Sounds a Global Alarm Over Zika Virus

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

abstract: World Health Organization issues worldwide warning over Zika virus, contending disease is 'spreading explosively' in Latin America and Caribbean and up to four million people could be infected by end of 2016; more than 20 countries have reported cases; agency is planning special meeting to determine whether to declare public health emergency.
